page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: I will describe our area and the activities of the people who live in it. Our survey area covers the northern slopes of the Mendip Hills and the Vale of Wrington.The ridge of the limestone hills is bleak and exposed, but the slopes are heavily wooded.The communities of Burrington, Upper Langford, Doleberrow and Churchill are at the foot of these slopes.To the north of the villages the land is largely agricultural grassland supporting beef and dairy cattle. Two major roads intersect at Churchill Gate.The A368 Bath to Weston road follows the foot of the slope of the hills, whilst the A38 is a major road from the South West to the North Midlands. The M5, built 15 years ago, has taken away much of the traffic. The road is still very busy.
